title: Islamist militants accused of killing 34 in raids on Nigerian villages

originalTitle: Sudan atrocities are 'hallmarks of genocide', UN says
title: Helpers are Looking Out for Kids in Sudan!
content:
Hello, my little friends from all over Africa! I'm your friendly news reporter, and today we're talking about a place called Sudan. Sudan is a big country right here in Africa, just like where you live! Sometimes, grown-ups have big troubles, and it can make things hard for everyone, especially for children. We're going to talk about some helpers who are trying to make things better in Sudan.

What is Happening in Sudan?

Imagine your town or village. It's where you play with your friends, go to school, and live with your family. Now imagine if some groups of grown-ups started fighting in your town. That's what has been happening in parts of Sudan. This fighting makes many people very sad and scared. Sometimes, families have to leave their homes because it's not safe anymore. They might have to go to a new place to find safety, even if it means leaving their toys and school behind. This is a very difficult time for many children and families in Sudan. They want to be safe, play, and go to school, just like you. Did you know? Sudan is the third-largest country in Africa by size! It has many beautiful places and friendly people.

A Special Group of Helpers

There is a very important group of helpers in the world called the United Nations, or UN for short. The UN is like a big team of grown-ups from many different countries. Their job is to try and help people everywhere, especially when they are in trouble. The UN wants everyone to live in peace. They want children to be safe, happy, and able to go to school. So, when there's fighting or problems, the UN sends people to see what is happening and how they can help. Recently, some helpers from the UN went to a town in Sudan called El-Fasher. El-Fasher is a town where many people live, and it has been a place where a lot of fighting has happened.

What Did the Helpers Find?

These special UN helpers went to El-Fasher to listen to people and see what was going on. They wanted to understand why people were sad and what kinds of troubles they were facing. They talked to many people, like mothers and fathers, and even some children, to hear their stories. When they came back, they wrote a report. A report is like a very important story that grown-ups write down to explain things. In their report, the UN helpers said that they saw signs of very, very sad and unfair things happening. They saw signs that some people were being hurt or treated badly just because of who they are, or where they come from. These kinds of sad things are sometimes called 'hallmarks of genocide' by grown-ups. It means there are signs that a whole group of people might be in danger, and that's a very serious problem. It means grown-ups are worried that a whole group of friends might not be safe, and that's not fair at all. Did you know? The United Nations was started after a very big war, to help stop future wars and make the world a more peaceful place for everyone.

Who are the Rapid Support Forces?

In Sudan, there are different groups of grown-ups who are fighting. One of these groups is called the Rapid Support Forces. They were involved in the fighting that happened in El-Fasher. The UN helpers looked into what this group did. They found that when the Rapid Support Forces took over El-Fasher, many bad things happened. People's homes were broken, and some people were hurt. It made many, many people scared. It's like when kids have a disagreement on the playground, but much, much bigger and more serious. When grown-ups fight, it can make it very hard for everyone else to live a normal life.

Why is This Important?

When the UN helpers share what they found, it's very important. It means they are telling the whole world about the troubles in Sudan. It helps other grown-ups, like leaders of countries, understand what is happening. When more people know, more people can try to help. They can send food, medicine, or even talk to the groups who are fighting to ask them to stop. The UN wants to make sure that everyone, especially children, is safe and treated fairly. They want to make sure that no group of people is hurt just because they are different. Every child deserves to feel safe, to have a home, to eat yummy food, and to go to school to learn and play. Did you know? Children all over the world have special rights! One of these rights is to be safe and to go to school.

Hope for a Better Tomorrow

Even when things are very sad, there is always hope. Many good grown-ups are working very hard to bring peace back to Sudan. They want the fighting to stop so that children can go back to their homes, play with their friends, and learn in school again. We all hope for a day very soon when the sun shines brightly in Sudan, and all children can laugh and play without any worries. The UN helpers are there to make sure everyone remembers that children need peace and safety. So, let's all send our kindest thoughts to the children in Sudan. Let's hope that the helpers can make a big difference and bring smiles back to their faces very soon. Remember, kindness and peace are the best things for everyone, everywhere!
summary: A special group of helpers called the UN found very sad things happening to people in Sudan, especially in a town called El-Fasher, and they are working to help bring peace and safety back to the children there.
whyMatters: This is important because when grown-ups fight, it makes children and families very sad and unsafe, so helpers like the UN need to tell everyone so we can all work to make sure kids in Sudan can be safe, happy, and go to school again.
